title: 107_hr700
content: The "Asian Elephant Conservation Reauthorization Act of 2002" amends the Asian Elephant Conservation Act of 1997 to extend authorization through 2007. It also limits administrative expenses to 3% or $80,000 annually. Cooperation is emphasized in the Act. SEC. 4. COOPERATION. The Asian Elephant Conservation Act of 1997 is further amended by redesignating section 7 as section 8, and by inserting after section 6 the following: "SEC. 7. ADVISORY GROUP." The Secretary may convene an advisory group of individuals involved in Asian elephant conservation. The group must hold open meetings, provide opportunities for public input, give timely notice of meetings, and keep minutes available to the public. The group is exempt from the Federal Advisory Committee Act. The advisory group for Asian elephant conservation is exempt from the Federal Advisory Committee Act. SEC. 5. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The Asian Elephant Conservation Act of 1997 is amended to update references to the conservation fund and donations acceptance. The Asian Elephant Conservation Act of 1997 is amended to update references to the conservation fund and donations acceptance. Technical corrections are made to the multinational species conservation fund in title I of the Department of the Interior and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999. The African Elephant Conservation Act is amended to update references and make technical corrections. Effective upon the enactment of the African Elephant Conservation Reauthorization Act of 2001, certain sections are amended to replace "this Act" with "this title". SEC. 6. Authorization of appropriations for National Fish and Wildlife Foundation is amended to increase funding from $20,000,000 to $25,000,000 in 2005.
